name: Namo Shetkari Mahasanman Nidhi Yojana
description: State top-up scheme providing an additional ₹6,000 per year (₹2,000 every four months) to PM-Kisan beneficiaries via Direct Benefit Transfer.
target_group: Farmers already enrolled in PM-Kisan scheme

other: Must be a PM-Kisan beneficiary

benefits: Additional financial support of ₹6,000 per year
Automatic enrollment for existing PM-Kisan beneficiaries

steps: Ensure you are registered under the central PM-KISAN scheme.
Verify that your Aadhaar and bank account details are correctly linked to PM-KISAN.
No separate registration is needed for this scheme.
Eligible beneficiaries will automatically receive ₹2,000 every 4 months via DBT.
how_to_apply.portal: PM-KISAN registration and status details are used
how_to_apply.deadline: None – Ongoing disbursement based on PM-KISAN status

required_documents: No additional documents required for existing PM-Kisan beneficiaries

faq.q: Do I need to apply separately for this scheme?
faq.a: No, if you're already a PM-Kisan beneficiary, you will automatically receive the additional amount.

faq.q: When was this scheme launched?
faq.a: The scheme was launched on June 15, 2023 by GR No. Kisani-2023/CR 42/11 A.

faq.q: How will I receive the payment?
faq.a: The amount will be directly transferred to your bank account through DBT.

name: Mahatma Jyotirao Phule Shetkari Karj Mukti Yojana
description: Waives crop loans up to ₹2 lakh for small and marginal farmers with loans outstanding as of September 30, 2019.
target_group: Small and marginal farmers with outstanding crop loans

other: Small or marginal farmer
Outstanding crop loan as of September 30, 2019

benefits: Waiver of crop loans up to ₹2 lakh

steps: Check if your name appears in the published beneficiary lists by local authorities
Submit required documents at your nearest agriculture office
Wait for verification of loan documents and eligibility
Loan waiver will be processed after successful verification

faq.q: How do I know if I'm eligible for this loan waiver?
faq.a: Lists of beneficiaries were published in early 2020. Small and marginal farmers with crop loans outstanding as of September 30, 2019 were eligible.

faq.q: How was the loan waiver processed?
faq.a: Lenders were paid directly by the government, and the loans were cleared from farmers' accounts.

name: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Krishi Sanman Yojana
description: A comprehensive loan waiver scheme that cleared NPAs for distressed farmers under the 2017 state budget.
target_group: Distressed farmers with non-performing agricultural loans

other: Distressed farmer with non-performing agricultural loans

steps: Visit your district agriculture office with required documents
Submit loan documents and distress proof
Complete verification process with district officials
Wait for loan clearance confirmation

faq.q: How were farmers verified for this scheme?
faq.a: District agriculture officers verified eligibility of farmers based on their loan status and distress condition.

faq.q: How were the debts settled?
faq.a: Debts were settled via state budget allocations directly to lending institutions.

name: APL Farmer DBT Scheme
description: Quarterly cash transfers to Above-Poverty-Line farmers, based on Maharashtra land-record and crop data.
target_group: Above-Poverty-Line farmers in Maharashtra

other: Above-Poverty-Line farmer
Must have verified land records

benefits: Automatic disbursement through state agriculture portal

steps: Ensure your land records are updated in the state database
Verify APL status through PDS system linkage
Link Aadhaar with bank account for DBT
Quarterly payments will be automatically processed

faq.q: How is the APL status verified?
faq.a: APL status is verified through government records linked to Aadhaar and PDS system data.

faq.q: How much money do farmers receive under this scheme?
faq.a: The amount varies based on land holding and crop type, disbursed quarterly through DBT.

name: Gopinath Munde Shetkari Apghat Suraksha Sanugrah Yojana
description: State-funded accident insurance providing ₹1-2 lakh coverage for registered farmers.
target_group: Registered farmers in Maharashtra

other: Must be a registered farmer

benefits: Financial security in case of accidents

steps: Visit the state agriculture portal insurance section
Register with your farmer ID and Aadhaar details
Upload required documents for verification
Receive insurance policy details after approval

faq.q: What documents are needed for claim settlement?
faq.a: Claim settlement requires FIR or medical certificate submission to the agriculture insurer.

faq.q: Who is covered under this insurance scheme?
faq.a: All registered farmers in Maharashtra are eligible for this state-funded accident insurance coverage.

name: Milk Producers Subsidy Scheme
description: A per-litre subsidy for dairy producers supplying government-recognized cooperatives.
target_group: Dairy farmers supplying to recognized cooperatives

other: Must supply milk to government-recognized cooperatives

benefits: Direct Benefit Transfer to farmers' accounts

steps: Register with a government-recognized dairy cooperative
Link your Aadhaar and bank account details
Submit milk supply records for verification
Receive subsidy through DBT based on supply

required_documents: Proof of milk supply to recognized cooperative

faq.q: How is the subsidy amount calculated?
faq.a: The subsidy is calculated based on e-verified milk-procurement records on a per-litre basis.

faq.q: How often is the subsidy paid?
faq.a: The subsidy is paid through DBT based on regular procurement cycles, typically monthly.

name: Cotton and Soybean Farmers Subsidy Scheme
description: When market rates for cotton/soybean fall below MSP, registered cultivators receive gap-filling DBT up to the cap.
target_group: Cotton and soybean farmers in Maharashtra

other: Must be a registered cotton or soybean cultivator

benefits: Price gap compensation when market rates fall below MSP
Financial stability for cotton and soybean farmers

steps: Register on the Food Processing Department portal
Submit crop cultivation details and MSP documentation
Link Aadhaar and bank account for DBT
Receive automatic compensation when prices fall below MSP

faq.q: What types of food processing units are eligible?
faq.a: Units processing fruits, vegetables, cereals, and other agricultural produce are eligible under this scheme.

faq.q: How is the subsidy disbursed?
faq.a: The subsidy is released after plant commissioning and expenditure verification by authorized officials.

name: RKVY Plastic Lining to Farm Ponds
description: Subsidy for plastic lining of farm ponds to reduce water seepage and improve water storage for efficient irrigation.
target_group: Farmers in Maharashtra with existing or planned farm ponds

other: Must have or plan to construct a farm pond

benefits: Plastic lining for farm ponds at subsidized cost
Extended water availability during dry seasons

steps: Register on the Mahadbt portal
Submit farm pond details and plastic lining requirements
Upload required documents for verification
Receive approval and subsidy disbursement

required_documents: Farm pond plan or existing pond photo/details

faq.q: Who is eligible for the RKVY Plastic Lining to Farm Ponds scheme?
faq.a: Farmers in Maharashtra who have an existing farm pond or plan to construct one are eligible.

faq.q: How much subsidy will I receive?
faq.a: The government provides a subsidy on the cost of plastic lining. The exact amount depends on the pond's size and official cost estimates.

faq.q: Where can I apply for this scheme?
faq.a: You can apply online through the Mahadbt portal at https://mahadbt.maharashtra.gov.in/rkvy.

faq.q: What documents are required for application?
faq.a: You need your 7/12 land extract, Aadhaar card, bank account details, and details or photo of the existing/planned pond.

faq.q: Is the scheme available across Maharashtra?
faq.a: Yes, the scheme is applicable in all districts of Maharashtra.

name: Onion Farmers Subsidy Scheme
description: Triggered when wholesale onion prices drop under the threshold (e.g., ₹1,800/quintal). Growers registered with the Agricultural Marketing Board get DBT to cover the shortfall.
target_group: Onion farmers registered with Agricultural Marketing Board

other: Must be registered with the Agricultural Marketing Board as an onion grower

benefits: Price gap compensation when onion prices fall below threshold

steps: Register with the Agricultural Marketing Board
Link Aadhaar and bank account for DBT
Submit crop details and sale records
Receive automatic compensation when prices fall below threshold

faq.q: What is the threshold price that triggers this subsidy?
faq.a: The subsidy is triggered when wholesale onion prices drop below ₹1,800 per quintal.

faq.q: How do farmers get registered with the Agricultural Marketing Board?
faq.a: Farmers need to register through their local APMC or online through the Maharashtra State Agricultural Marketing Board portal.

name: Group Farming Scheme (Gat Sheti Yojana)
description: Registered farmer groups (min. 10 members, 100 acres) receive up to ₹1 crore for shared infrastructure like equipment and storage facilities.
target_group: Groups of farmers willing to farm collectively

other: Minimum 10 farmers in a group
Collective land holding of at least 100 acres

benefits: Up to ₹1 crore funding for shared infrastructure

steps: Form a group of minimum 10 farmers with required land holding
Register the group with the Agriculture Department
Submit detailed project proposal for infrastructure
Receive funding after technical and financial verification

required_documents: Bank account details of the group

faq.q: How is the funding administered?
faq.a: The funding is administered with NABARD support and state grants based on project milestones.

faq.q: What kinds of infrastructure can be funded?
faq.a: Eligible infrastructure includes farm equipment, storage facilities, processing units, and irrigation systems.

name: Jalyukt Shivar Abhiyan
description: A flagship joint (state + central) mission to make villages drought-free by building check-dams, desilting tanks, and restoring water bodies.
target_group: Drought-prone villages in Maharashtra

other: Priority to drought-prone areas

steps: Gram Panchayat submits proposal through Rural Development portal
Submit drought status documentation and water resource map
Wait for technical assessment and approval
Implementation begins after approval

faq.q: How are villages selected for this scheme?
faq.a: Villages are selected based on drought vulnerability, groundwater depletion, and willingness of the Gram Panchayat to participate.

faq.q: When was this scheme implemented?
faq.a: The scheme was rolled out in 2016 with gram-panchayat execution after being launched in 2015.

name: Chief Minister Sustainable Agriculture Irrigation Scheme (Magel Tyala Shettale)
description: Subsidizes 50% of farm-pond construction costs for small/marginal farmers in drought-prone blocks.
target_group: Small and marginal farmers in drought-prone areas

other: Small or marginal farmer
Land in drought-prone block

benefits: Enhanced crop resilience during dry periods

steps: Register on the state agriculture portal
Submit farm-pond construction plan and required documents
Wait for site inspection and approval
Receive subsidy after construction verification

faq.q: How is the subsidy disbursed?
faq.a: Applications are processed via the state-agriculture portal, with inspection-verified DBT after construction.

faq.q: What is the maximum subsidy amount available?
faq.a: The subsidy covers 50% of the construction cost, with specific caps based on pond dimensions and district.

name: Mukhyamantri Baliraja Bijli Savalat Yojana
description: Provides concessional or free electricity for agricultural pump-sets to support irrigation.
target_group: Farmers using electric pump-sets for irrigation

other: Must have agricultural land with electric pump-sets

benefits: Concessional or free electricity for agricultural pump-sets

steps: Visit your local MSEDCL office
Submit agricultural land and pump-set documents
Complete registration process
Receive tariff benefits on next billing cycle

faq.q: How are the tariff waivers applied?
faq.a: Farmers register through local DISCOMs; tariff waivers apply automatically on billing.

faq.q: What is the eligibility criteria for free electricity?
faq.a: Eligibility for free electricity depends on landholding size, pump-set capacity, and region-specific criteria.

name: Gaav Tithe Godam Yojana
description: Offers up to 75% cost-grant for FPOs or cooperatives to build/renovate village-level godowns for agricultural storage.
target_group: Farmer Producer Organizations and Cooperatives

other: Must be a registered FPO or cooperative
Proposal for village-level godown

benefits: Up to 75% grant for godown construction/renovation
Improved storage infrastructure at village level

steps: Register FPO/Cooperative on Agriculture Department portal
Submit detailed godown construction/renovation proposal
Wait for technical and financial verification
Receive grant after construction milestones

faq.q: How is the grant disbursed?
faq.a: Beneficiaries submit invoices for DBT reimbursement after construction milestones are achieved and verified.

faq.q: What is the maximum grant amount available?
faq.a: The grant covers up to 75% of the construction/renovation cost, with specific caps based on godown capacity.

name: State Level Innovative Scheme (Farm Mechanization Support)
description: Tiered subsidies (25-50%) for farm machinery purchase (tractors, seeders, etc.), prioritized for SC/ST and women farmers.
target_group: All farmers, with priority to SC/ST and women farmers

other: All farmers eligible, with priority to SC/ST and women farmers

benefits: Higher subsidy rates for SC/ST and women farmers

steps: Register on the Agriculture Department portal
Submit machinery purchase proposal and required documents
Priority processing for SC/ST and women farmers
Receive subsidy after purchase verification

faq.q: What types of machinery are covered under this scheme?
faq.a: The scheme covers tractors, seeders, harvesters, threshers, and other agricultural machinery approved by the department.

faq.q: What is the subsidy percentage for different categories?
faq.a: General category farmers receive 25% subsidy, while SC/ST and women farmers receive up to 50% subsidy on approved machinery.

name: Seed Village Programme
description: Provides a 50% subsidy on certified foundation/certified seeds in designated 'seed villages' to improve seed quality and availability.
target_group: Farmers in designated seed villages

other: Must be farming in a designated seed village

steps: Verify if your village is designated as a seed village
Register with local agricultural cooperative
Submit required documents for verification
Receive subsidized seeds through cooperative

required_documents: Proof of farming in seed village

faq.q: How are seed villages designated?
faq.a: Seed villages are designated by the Agriculture Department based on agro-climatic suitability for quality seed production.

faq.q: How is the subsidy disbursed?
faq.a: Farmers procure through cooperatives and receive DBT upon receipt verification.

name: Demonstration Inputs Scheme
description: Grants ₹5,000 per hectare for demonstration plots showcasing improved inputs or technologies to promote adoption of better farming practices.
target_group: Progressive farmers willing to create demonstration plots

other: Willing to create and maintain demonstration plots
Allow farmer field visits

steps: Contact your district agriculture officer
Submit demonstration plot proposal
Get technical approval from experts
Receive grant after plot establishment

faq.q: What technologies or inputs can be demonstrated?
faq.a: Approved technologies include improved seed varieties, cultivation methods, pest management techniques, and other department-approved innovations.

faq.q: How is the grant disbursed?
faq.a: The grant is managed by district agriculture officers and disbursed via DBT after on-field inspection confirms the demonstration plot is established.

name: Chief Minister Agriculture and Food Processing Scheme
description: A 30% capital subsidy for establishing food-processing units for fruits, vegetables, and cereals to promote value addition in agriculture.
target_group: Entrepreneurs and FPOs interested in food processing

other: Entrepreneurs or FPOs
Proposal for food processing unit

benefits: 30% capital subsidy for food processing units

steps: Register on Food Processing Department portal
Submit detailed project report and financial projections
Get technical and financial verification
Receive subsidy after plant commissioning

faq.q: What types of food processing units are eligible?
faq.a: Units processing fruits, vegetables, cereals, and other agricultural produce are eligible under this scheme.

faq.q: How is the subsidy disbursed?
faq.a: The subsidy is released after plant commissioning and expenditure verification by authorized officials.

name: Bhausaheb Fundkar Falbag Lagvad Scheme
description: Scheme to promote fruit cultivation by providing financial assistance to farmers for planting perennial fruit crops.
target_group: All farmers in Maharashtra

other: Must own agricultural land suitable for fruit cultivation
Priority to small and marginal farmers

benefits: Financial assistance for planting perennial fruit crops
Support for crops like mango, pomegranate, guava, and lemon

steps: Apply through local Agriculture Department office
Submit required documents
Field verification by agriculture officials
Approval and fund disbursement

faq.q: How many farmers benefited in 2024-25?
faq.a: Over 27,000 farmers received aid under this scheme in the financial year 2024-25

faq.q: What fruit crops are supported?
faq.a: Perennial fruit crops like mango, pomegranate, guava, and lemon

implementation: Implemented by Department of Agriculture, Government of Maharashtra

name: Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar Krishi Swalamban Yojana
description: Scheme aimed at empowering Scheduled Caste farmers by offering subsidies for agricultural equipment, irrigation facilities, and other inputs.
target_group: Scheduled Caste farmers

other: Must belong to Scheduled Caste category
Must own agricultural land or have tenancy rights
Income criteria as per government norms

steps: Apply through local Agriculture Department or Social Welfare office
Submit caste certificate and other required documents
Verification by authorities
Approval and subsidy disbursement

faq.q: What is the subsidy percentage available?
faq.a: Subsidy percentages vary based on the type of equipment/facility, typically ranging from 50-100%

faq.q: Is there a cap on the subsidy amount?
faq.a: Yes, maximum subsidy limits are defined based on the type of equipment/facility being supported

implementation: Implemented by Social Welfare Department in coordination with Department of Agriculture, Government of Maharashtra

name: Birsa Munda Krishi Kranti Yojana
description: Initiative targeted towards tribal farmers to provide support for modernizing agricultural practices, including assistance for irrigation, mechanization, and crop diversification.
target_group: Tribal farmers

other: Must belong to Scheduled Tribe category
Must own agricultural land or have recognized cultivation rights
Priority to farmers in tribal-dominated areas

steps: Apply through local Tribal Development Department or Agriculture Department office
Submit tribal certificate and other required documents
Verification by authorities
Approval and benefit disbursement
how_to_apply.deadline: Rolling applications based on fund availability

faq.q: What crop diversification options are supported?
faq.a: Support for transitioning to high-value crops, traditional tribal crops, and sustainable farming practices

faq.q: Are communal tribal lands eligible?
faq.a: Yes, with proper documentation and tribal council approval

implementation: Implemented by Tribal Development Department in coordination with Department of Agriculture, Government of Maharashtra

name: Integrated Horticulture Development Mission
description: Mission focusing on the holistic development of the horticulture sector by providing support for nursery development, post-harvest management, and marketing infrastructure.
target_group: Horticulture farmers, entrepreneurs, and cooperatives

other: Individuals, groups, or organizations involved in horticulture
Land suitability for horticulture activities
Compliance with environmental guidelines

benefits: Support for nursery development and quality planting material

steps: Apply through District Horticulture Officer
Submit project proposal and required documents
Technical and financial evaluation
Approval and phased fund disbursement

faq.q: What post-harvest infrastructure is supported?
faq.a: Sorting, grading units, packhouses, cold storage facilities, ripening chambers, and transportation vehicles

faq.q: Are there provisions for organic horticulture?
faq.a: Yes, special incentives are available for organic horticulture practices

implementation: Implemented by Department of Horticulture, Government of Maharashtra

name: Dryland Area Development Programme
description: Program designed for regions with low rainfall, emphasizing soil and water conservation, crop diversification, and sustainable farming practices to improve productivity.
target_group: Farmers in dryland/rainfed regions

other: Farming in identified dryland/low rainfall areas
Willingness to adopt sustainable practices
Priority to small and marginal farmers

benefits: Support for soil and water conservation structures

steps: Village-level watershed committees formation
Participatory rural appraisal and needs assessment
Development of area-specific plans
Implementation through community participation

faq.q: What soil conservation techniques are promoted?
faq.a: Contour bunding, farm ponds, check dams, trenching, and other watershed management techniques

faq.q: What crops are recommended for dryland farming?
faq.a: Drought-resistant varieties of millets, pulses, oilseeds, and other climate-appropriate crops

implementation: Implemented by Watershed Development Department in coordination with Department of Agriculture, Government of Maharashtra

name: Project on Climate Resilient Agriculture (PoCRA)
description: Also known as Nanaji Deshmukh Krishi Sanjeevani Prakalp, PoCRA aims to enhance the resilience of agriculture to climate change by promoting sustainable farming practices.
target_group: Farmers in climate-vulnerable areas

other: Farming in identified 5,142 villages across Maharashtra
Vulnerability to climate change impacts
Priority to small and marginal farmers

steps: Register on PoCRA portal or through Village Climate Resilient Agriculture Management Committees
Submit required documents
Technical and financial assessment
Approval and implementation support

faq.q: How many villages are covered under PoCRA?
faq.a: 5,142 villages across Maharashtra

faq.q: What are the major components of PoCRA?
faq.a: Climate-resilient agriculture systems, water security, institutional development, and knowledge sharing

implementation: Implemented by Project Management Unit under Department of Agriculture, Government of Maharashtra

name: State Agricultural Mechanization Scheme
description: Scheme providing subsidies to farmers for purchasing modern agricultural machinery and equipment, aiming to increase efficiency and reduce labor dependency.
target_group: All farmers in Maharashtra

other: Active farmer with land ownership/cultivation rights
Enhanced subsidies for SC/ST/women farmers
Special provisions for farmer groups and cooperatives

benefits: Subsidies for purchasing tractors, tillers, harvesters, etc.
Training on machinery operation and maintenance

steps: Register on Agricultural Mechanization Portal
Select equipment and dealer
Submit required documents
Approval and subsidy disbursement
how_to_apply.deadline: Rolling applications based on fund availability

faq.q: What is the subsidy percentage?
faq.a: General category: 40-50%, SC/ST/women farmers: 50-60%, Higher subsidies for specific equipment

faq.q: Is there a cap on equipment cost?
faq.a: Yes, maximum eligible cost is defined for each category of equipment

implementation: Implemented by Department of Agriculture, Government of Maharashtra

name: Dr. Shyama Prasad Mukherjee Jan Van Vikas Yojana
description: Scheme focused on forest fringe villages, supporting agroforestry and sustainable livelihoods through community participation and resource management.
target_group: Farmers in forest fringe villages

other: Residing in identified forest fringe villages
Willingness to adopt agroforestry practices
Community participation in resource management

benefits: Assistance for sustainable non-timber forest product harvesting

steps: Formation of Village Forest Management Committees
Development of community resource management plans
Submission through Forest Department
Approval and phased implementation

faq.q: What agroforestry models are promoted?
faq.a: Multi-tier cropping systems, boundary plantations, silvopasture, and other sustainable models

faq.q: How is community participation ensured?
faq.a: Through Village Forest Management Committees and participatory planning processes

implementation: Implemented by Forest Department in coordination with Rural Development Department, Government of Maharashtra
